00038 /************************** PRIVATE DEFINTIONS ***********************/
00039 // PORT number that /CS pin assigned on
00040 #define CS_PORT_NUM             0
00041 // PIN number that  /CS pin assigned on
00042 #define CS_PIN_NUM              16
00043 
00044 /* Idle char */
00045 #define IDLE_CHAR       0xFF
00046 
00047 // Define macro used in command when using SSP with SC16IS740
00048 #define SC16IS740_WR_CMD(x)             ((uint8_t) (x << 3))
00049 #define SC16IS740_RD_CMD(x)             ((uint8_t) ((x << 3) | 0x80))
00050 
00051 // Define register address of SC16IS740
00052 #define SC16IS740_IODIR_REG             0x0A
00053 #define SC16IS740_IOSTATE_REG   0x0B
00054 #define SC16IS740_IOCON_REG             0x0E
00055 
00056 /************************** PRIVATE VARIABLES *************************/
00057 uint8_t menu1[] =
00058 "********************************************************************************\n\r"
00059 "Hello NXP Semiconductors \n\r"
00060 "SSP demo \n\r"
00061 "\t - MCU: LPC17xx \n\r"
00062 "\t - Core: ARM Cortex-M3 \n\r"
00063 "\t - Communicate via: UART0 - 9.6 kbps \n\r"
00064 " An example of SSP using interrupt mode - SPI frame format \n\r"
00065 "to test SSP driver \n\r"
00066 " Using SSP at mode SSP master/8bit on LPC1768 to communicate with \n\r"
00067 " SC16IS750/760 Demo Board \n\r"
00068 " Press '1' to turn on LEDs, '2' to turn off LEDs \n\r"
00069 "********************************************************************************\n\r";
00070 uint8_t menu2[] = "Demo terminated! \n\r";
00071 
00072 uint8_t iocon_cfg[2] = {SC16IS740_WR_CMD(SC16IS740_IOCON_REG), 0x00};
00073 uint8_t iodir_cfg[2] = {SC16IS740_WR_CMD(SC16IS740_IODIR_REG), 0xFF};
00074 uint8_t iostate_on[2] = {SC16IS740_WR_CMD(SC16IS740_IOSTATE_REG), 0x00};
00075 uint8_t iostate_off[2] = {SC16IS740_WR_CMD(SC16IS740_IOSTATE_REG), 0xFF};
00076 uint8_t sspreadbuf[2];
00077 
00078 /* Status Flag indicates current SSP transmission complete or not */
00079 __IO FlagStatus complete;
00080

00082 SSP_CFG_Type SSP_ConfigStruct;
00083 SSP_DATA_SETUP_Type xferConfig;

00093 /*----------------- INTERRUPT SERVICE ROUTINES --------------------------*/
00094 /*********************************************************************/
00099 void SSP0_IRQHandler(void)
00100 {
00101         SSP_DATA_SETUP_Type *xf_setup;
00102         uint16_t tmp;
00103         uint8_t dataword;
00104 
00105         // Disable all SSP interrupts
00106         SSP_IntConfig(LPC_SSP0, SSP_INTCFG_ROR|SSP_INTCFG_RT|SSP_INTCFG_RX|SSP_INTCFG_TX, DISABLE);
00107 
00108         if(SSP_GetDataSize(LPC_SSP0)>8)
00109                 dataword = 1;
00110         else
00111                 dataword = 0;
00112         xf_setup = &xferConfig;
00113         // save status
00114         tmp = SSP_GetRawIntStatusReg(LPC_SSP0);
00115         xf_setup->status = tmp;
00116 
00117         // Check overrun error
00118         if (tmp & SSP_RIS_ROR){
00119                 // Clear interrupt
00120                 SSP_ClearIntPending(LPC_SSP0, SSP_INTCLR_ROR);
00121                 // update status
00122                 xf_setup->status |= SSP_STAT_ERROR;
00123                 // Set Complete Flag
00124                 complete = SET;
00125                 return;
00126         }
00127 
00128         if ((xf_setup->tx_cnt != xf_setup->length) || (xf_setup->rx_cnt != xf_setup->length)){
00129                 /* check if RX FIFO contains data */
00130                 while ((SSP_GetStatus(LPC_SSP0, SSP_STAT_RXFIFO_NOTEMPTY)) && (xf_setup->rx_cnt != xf_setup->length)){
00131                         // Read data from SSP data
00132                         tmp = SSP_ReceiveData(LPC_SSP0);
00133 
00134                         // Store data to destination
00135                         if (xf_setup->rx_data != NULL)
00136                         {
00137                                 if (dataword == 0){
00138                                         *(uint8_t *)((uint32_t)xf_setup->rx_data + xf_setup->rx_cnt) = (uint8_t) tmp;
00139                                 } else {
00140                                         *(uint16_t *)((uint32_t)xf_setup->rx_data + xf_setup->rx_cnt) = (uint16_t) tmp;
00141                                 }
00142                         }
00143                         // Increase counter
00144                         if (dataword == 0){
00145                                 xf_setup->rx_cnt++;
00146                         } else {
00147                                 xf_setup->rx_cnt += 2;
00148                         }
00149                 }
00150 
00151                 while ((SSP_GetStatus(LPC_SSP0, SSP_STAT_TXFIFO_NOTFULL)) && (xf_setup->tx_cnt != xf_setup->length)){
00152                         // Write data to buffer
00153                         if(xf_setup->tx_data == NULL){
00154                                 if (dataword == 0){
00155                                         SSP_SendData(LPC_SSP0, 0xFF);
00156                                         xf_setup->tx_cnt++;
00157                                 } else {
00158                                         SSP_SendData(LPC_SSP0, 0xFFFF);
00159                                         xf_setup->tx_cnt += 2;
00160                                 }
00161                         } else {
00162                                 if (dataword == 0){
00163                                         SSP_SendData(LPC_SSP0, (*(uint8_t *)((uint32_t)xf_setup->tx_data + xf_setup->tx_cnt)));
00164                                         xf_setup->tx_cnt++;
00165                                 } else {
00166                                         SSP_SendData(LPC_SSP0, (*(uint16_t *)((uint32_t)xf_setup->tx_data + xf_setup->tx_cnt)));
00167                                         xf_setup->tx_cnt += 2;
00168                                 }
00169                         }
00170 
00171                         // Check overrun error
00172                         if (SSP_GetRawIntStatus(LPC_SSP0, SSP_INTSTAT_RAW_ROR)){
00173                                 // update status
00174                                 xf_setup->status |= SSP_STAT_ERROR;
00175                                 // Set Complete Flag
00176                                 complete = SET;
00177                                 return;
00178                         }
00179 
00180                         // Check for any data available in RX FIFO
00181                         while ((SSP_GetStatus(LPC_SSP0, SSP_STAT_RXFIFO_NOTEMPTY)) && (xf_setup->rx_cnt != xf_setup->length)){
00182                                 // Read data from SSP data
00183                                 tmp = SSP_ReceiveData(LPC_SSP0);
00184 
00185                                 // Store data to destination
00186                                 if (xf_setup->rx_data != NULL)
00187                                 {
00188                                         if (dataword == 0){
00189                                                 *(uint8_t *)((uint32_t)xf_setup->rx_data + xf_setup->rx_cnt) = (uint8_t) tmp;
00190                                         } else {
00191                                                 *(uint16_t *)((uint32_t)xf_setup->rx_data + xf_setup->rx_cnt) = (uint16_t) tmp;
00192                                         }
00193                                 }
00194                                 // Increase counter
00195                                 if (dataword == 0){
00196                                         xf_setup->rx_cnt++;
00197                                 } else {
00198                                         xf_setup->rx_cnt += 2;
00199                                 }
00200                         }
00201                 }
00202         }
00203 
00204         // If there more data to sent or receive
00205         if ((xf_setup->rx_cnt != xf_setup->length) || (xf_setup->tx_cnt != xf_setup->length)){
00206                 // Enable all interrupt
00207                 SSP_IntConfig(LPC_SSP0, SSP_INTCFG_ROR|SSP_INTCFG_RT|SSP_INTCFG_RX|SSP_INTCFG_TX, ENABLE);
00208         } else {
00209                 // Save status
00210                 xf_setup->status = SSP_STAT_DONE;
00211                 // Set Complete Flag
00212                 complete = SET;
00213         }
00214 }

00217 /*********************************************************************/
00223 void CS_Init(void)
00224 {
00225         GPIO_SetDir(CS_PORT_NUM, (1<<CS_PIN_NUM), 1);
00226         GPIO_SetValue(CS_PORT_NUM, (1<<CS_PIN_NUM));
00227 }
00228 
00229 
00230 /*********************************************************************/
00238 void CS_Force(int32_t state)
00239 {
00240         if (state){
00241                 GPIO_SetValue(CS_PORT_NUM, (1<<CS_PIN_NUM));
00242         }else{
00243                 GPIO_ClearValue(CS_PORT_NUM, (1<<CS_PIN_NUM));
00244         }
00245 }
00246 
00247 /*********************************************************************/
00252 void print_menu(void)
00253 {
00254         _DBG(menu1);
00255 }
00256 
00257 /*-------------------------MAIN FUNCTION------------------------------*/
00258 /*********************************************************************/
00263 int c_entry(void)
00264 {
00265         uint8_t tmpchar[2] = {0, 0};
00266         PINSEL_CFG_Type PinCfg;
00267         __IO FlagStatus exitflag;
00268 
00269         /*
00270          * Initialize SPI pin connect
00271          * P0.15 - SCK
00272          * P0.16 - SSEL - used as GPIO
00273          * P0.17 - MISO
00274          * P0.18 - MOSI
00275          */
00276         PinCfg.Funcnum = 2;
00277         PinCfg.OpenDrain = 0;
00278         PinCfg.Pinmode = 0;
00279         PinCfg.Portnum = 0;
00280         PinCfg.Pinnum = 15;
00281         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00282         PinCfg.Pinnum = 17;
00283         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00284         PinCfg.Pinnum = 18;
00285         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00286         PinCfg.Pinnum = 16;
00287         PinCfg.Funcnum = 0;
00288         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00289 
00290         /* Initialize debug via UART0
00291          * – 115200bps
00292          * – 8 data bit
00293          * – No parity
00294          * – 1 stop bit
00295          * – No flow control
00296          */
00297         debug_frmwrk_init();
00298 
00299         // print welcome screen
00300         print_menu();
00301 
00302         // initialize SSP configuration structure to default
00303         SSP_ConfigStructInit(&SSP_ConfigStruct);
00304         // Initialize SSP peripheral with parameter given in structure above
00305         SSP_Init(LPC_SSP0, &SSP_ConfigStruct);
00306 
00307         // Initialize /CS pin to GPIO function
00308         CS_Init();
00309 
00310         // Enable SSP peripheral
00311         SSP_Cmd(LPC_SSP0, ENABLE);
00312 
00313     /* preemption = 1, sub-priority = 1 */
00314     NVIC_SetPriority(SSP0_IRQn, ((0x01<<3)|0x01));
00315     /* Enable SSP0 interrupt */
00316     NVIC_EnableIRQ(SSP0_IRQn);
00317 
00318         /* First, send some command to reset SC16IS740 chip via SSP bus interface
00319          * note driver /CS pin to low state before transferring by CS_Enable() function
00320          */
00321     complete = RESET;
00322         CS_Force(0);
00323         xferConfig.tx_data = iocon_cfg;
00324         xferConfig.rx_data = sspreadbuf;
00325         xferConfig.length = sizeof (iocon_cfg);
00326         SSP_ReadWrite(LPC_SSP0, &xferConfig, SSP_TRANSFER_INTERRUPT);
00327         while (complete == RESET);
00328         CS_Force(1);
00329 
00330         complete = RESET;
00331         CS_Force(0);
00332         xferConfig.tx_data = iodir_cfg;
00333         xferConfig.rx_data = sspreadbuf;
00334         xferConfig.length = sizeof (iodir_cfg);
00335         SSP_ReadWrite(LPC_SSP0, &xferConfig, SSP_TRANSFER_INTERRUPT);
00336         while (complete == RESET);
00337         CS_Force(1);
00338 
00339         // Reset exit flag
00340         exitflag = RESET;
00341 
00342         /* Read some data from the buffer */
00343         while (exitflag == RESET)
00344         {
00345                 while((tmpchar[0] = _DG) == 0);
00346 
00347                 if (tmpchar[0] == 27){
00348                         /* ESC key, set exit flag */
00349                         _DBG_(menu2);
00350                         exitflag = SET;
00351                 }
00352                 else if (tmpchar[0] == 'r'){
00353                         print_menu();
00354                 } else {
00355                         if (tmpchar[0] == '1')
00356                         {
00357                                 // LEDs are ON now...
00358                                 CS_Force(0);
00359                                 xferConfig.tx_data = iostate_on;
00360                                 xferConfig.rx_data = sspreadbuf;
00361                                 xferConfig.length = sizeof (iostate_on);
00362                                 SSP_ReadWrite(LPC_SSP0, &xferConfig, SSP_TRANSFER_POLLING);
00363                                 CS_Force(1);
00364                         }
00365                         else if (tmpchar[0] == '2')
00366                         {
00367                                 // LEDs are OFF now...
00368                                 CS_Force(0);
00369                                 xferConfig.tx_data = iostate_off;
00370                                 xferConfig.rx_data = sspreadbuf;
00371                                 xferConfig.length = sizeof (iostate_off);
00372                                 SSP_ReadWrite(LPC_SSP0, &xferConfig, SSP_TRANSFER_POLLING);
00373                                 CS_Force(1);
00374                         }
00375                         /* Then Echo it back */
00376                         _DBG_(tmpchar);
00377                 }
00378         }
00379 
00380     // wait for current transmission complete - THR must be empty
00381     while (UART_CheckBusy(LPC_UART0) == SET );
00382 
00383     // DeInitialize UART0 peripheral
00384     UART_DeInit(LPC_UART0);
00385 
00386     /* Loop forever */
00387     while(1);
00388     return 1;
00389 }
00390 
00391 /* With ARM and GHS toolsets, the entry point is main() - this will
00392    allow the linker to generate wrapper code to setup stacks, allocate
00393    heap area, and initialize and copy code and data segments. For GNU
00394    toolsets, the entry point is through __start() in the crt0_gnu.asm
00395    file, and that startup code will setup stacks and data */
00396 int main(void)
00397 {
00398     return c_entry();
00399 }

00407 * @param[in]    line assert_param error line source number
00408 * @return               None
00409 *******************************************************************************/
00410 void check_failed(uint8_t *file, uint32_t line)

00412         /* User can add his own implementation to report the file name and line number,
00413          ex: printf("Wrong parameters value: file %s on line %d\r\n", file, line) */
00414 
00415         /* Infinite loop */
00416         while(1);
00417 }
